headlines: ‘We hoped not to use WebKit at all,' says Vivaldi CEO, as iOS browser ships
sub_headlines: With Europe's DMA in place, “the gatekeeper is no longer going to be able to dictate what you use or try to force you to use software you do not like," says Vivaldi chief Jon von Tetzchner.

headlines: The pursuit of Mac-iness: 10+ gifts to pros in macOS Sonoma
sub_headlines: There are some really useful productivity-boosting tools for enterprise users packed inside macOS Sonoma. Here are 10 that matter.

headlines: Jamf exec details how the Apple ecosystem will win the business market
sub_headlines: Michael Covington, Jamf's vice president of portfolio strategy, sees a lot of room for growth by Apple in the enterprise. In an interview, he spelled out why.

headlines: How to create your own iPhone-15-inspired 'Action button' on Android
sub_headlines: Got an Android phone — any Android phone? You can give yourself a power-packed custom button that'll make Apple's latest innovation look like child's play.

headlines: Cisco: Macs in business boost productivity and security, cuts costs
sub_headlines: Mac adoption isn’t just an employee choice; Cisco CIO Fletcher Previn argues that it’s a business imperative that delivers substantial benefits.

headlines: IDC: AR/VR headset sales slide, could rebound with Apple, Meta device launches
sub_headlines: The upcoming Meta Quest 3 is set to drive a rebound in business demand for AR/VR headsets, but  Apple’s Vision Pro is expected to have only a muted impact on commercial adoption.

headlines: Jamf: Generative AI is coming to an Apple IT admin near you
sub_headlines: Jamf believes generative AI tools can be a big benefit to tech support and IT admin and the company this week revealed its first work in that direction.

headlines: Jamf touts Jamf Pro 11 at JNUC, its annual Apple IT admin event
sub_headlines: The world’s biggest event for IT admins managing Apple devices, Jamf Nation User Conference, kicks off today in Austin, Texas.

headlines: Apple again upsells users to the iPhone 15 Pro Max
sub_headlines: Somewhere in Cupertino, the Spumante probably popped on news that initial quantities of Apple's top iPhone model for 2023 sold out in minutes. Delivery dates for the iPhone 15 Pro Max are now back to November.
Apple faces an EU-wide demand to update its old iPhone rather than engage in a costly product recall.
As the iPhone ages, let's look at how the now-iconic device has matured since its arrival in 2007.

headlines: This year's biggest tech IPO begins as ARM hits Nasdaq
sub_headlines: Arriving on the market at $51 per share, Arm waits to see whether investors believe it can pivot its business to maintain growth in a saturated smartphone market.

headlines: Does Apple’s double-tap gesture solve the mobile/human interface problem?
sub_headlines: Apple this week demonstrated a new gesture to use with the latest Apple Watch — a two-finger tapping motion. These kinds of gestures could represent a whole new way of interacting with computers and other tech devices.

headlines: 12 thoughts for business after Apple’s iPhone 15 launch
sub_headlines: Here are a dozen considerations business-minded people might want to keep in mind following this weeks unveiling of the iPhone 15 and 15 Pro.

headlines: Google's increasingly prickly Android perception problem
sub_headlines: Apple's convincing an entire generation of phone-buyers that Android is behind the times — which couldn't be much further from the truth.

headlines: Apple launches the iPhone 15 series, new Apple Watches — and talks up its green plans
sub_headlines: Not only did Apple introduce its latest bid for smartphone dominance — the iPhone 15 and 15 Pro — but it delivered a heavy focus on the environment and its progress toward becoming completely carbon neutral by 2030.

headlines: WWDC 2024: Is Apple on the road to Siri 2.0?
sub_headlines: Apple is making big investments in generative AI and machine learning, spending eye-watering amounts to build new learning models, presumably for Siri 2.0.
